intro: Fresenia foliosa, commonly known as the leafy broom. It is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil, and belongs to the Malvaceae family. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in soft, fuzzy hairs. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly wavy margin. It produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
